page.title: 03Tan-y-Groes/Sarnau, Dyfed
page.content: Sheep are kept mainly on the rougher pastures on hill-tops and near the sea. Most common breeds are { {Blackface & Speckleface. Suffolk and {Clun Rams}are crossed with local breeds to obtain extra yield and maintain hardiness. Classes in the September 1985{Llandysul}show included{Suffolk, Texel, Llanwenog, {Jacob, Speckleface, Welsh Mountain, {Welsh badger-faced, Blue-faced {Leicesters, Suffolk and Clun Rams. {Beulah sheep}may be a old local breed. Local markets at{Newcastle Emlyn}and {Llandysul}are used, with much buying of fat lambs to over-winter, as this area has a milder climate than much of the sheep-farming area of Wales. {Welsh}is used still used during auctions, although{English}is becoming more common.{EEC}subsidies are available to sheep-farmers in area.
